content.question: The decreasing function <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the mass of a sample of a radioactive element at time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The rate of change of the sample’s mass is proportional to the mass of the sample. Which of the following differential equations could be used to model the relationship between the mass of the sample and the rate of change of the sample’s mass, where <math alttext="k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a constant?

choices.label: <math alttext="the derivative of M, with respect to t, equals, k t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of M, with respect to t, equals, k M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of M, with respect to t, equals, the fraction k over t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of M, with respect to t, equals, the fraction k over M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of M, with respect to t, equals, k M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.G: Confirm that solutions are accurate and appropriate.
